page.title: 01Y Garn & the Llanberis Pass
page.content: This area consists of a mountainous region disected from SE to NW by a deep valley known as the Llanberis Pass. The North Eastern region s the mountain Y Garn which rises to 947 metres. From 400 metres on the open moorland, grazing for sheep is carried out. Below this level, fences & walls contain farm stock. The hamlet, Nant Peris lies in the valley. There are 2 campsites here and some simple tourist accommodation. The road which passes through the valley keeps close to the side of the mountain avoiding the flooding river. It is a major road from Caernarfon to England & is frequented by many touring coaches and holiday makers during the summer months.
